New Records: The San Diego Padres became the first team in MLB postseason history to get six consecutive hits and hit for the cycle in the same inning.
The Padres broke the record for the first time a team has six consecutive hits and a cycle in a single inning during the postseason.
Key Match Events: The Padres' five-run rally in the second inning turned the game around after Atlanta scored first.
Atlanta's offense scored a run in the top of the first inning before the Padres tied the game with a solo home run in the bottom of the second.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres entered the game with a 1-0 series lead, while the Braves were looking to tie the series after losing Game 1.
Atlanta scored early in Game 2 with a sacrifice fly by Marcell Ozuna in the first inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres advanced to the NLDS after their historic victory, securing a series sweep over the Atlanta Braves.
The Braves' playoff run was cut short with a loss in Game 2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a historic two-out rally in the second inning, which included six consecutive hits and a cycle by the Padres.
The Padres' rally was the first time in MLB history that a team had six consecutive hits and a cycle in the same inning during the postseason.
